Package com.intellij.openapi.util

Class RecursionGuard<Key>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intellij.openapi.util.RecursionGuard<Key>

  • public abstract class RecursionGuard<Key>
extends java.lang.Object
    A helper object for RecursionManager. It's obtained from RecursionManager.createGuard(String).

    • Method Detail

      • doPreventingRecursion

        public abstract <T> T doPreventingRecursion(Key key,
                                            boolean memoize,
                                            Computable<T> computation)
        Run the given computation, unless it's already running in this thread.
        Parameters:
        key - an id of the computation. It's stored internally to ensure that a recursive calls with the same key won't lead to endless recursion.
        memoize - whether the result of the computation may be cached thread-locally until the last currently active doPreventingRecursion call completes. May be used to speed up things when recursion re-entrance happens: otherwise nothing would be cached at all and in some cases exponential performance may be observed. Pass true if your computation has no side effects and doesn't depend on method parameters.
        computation - a piece of code to compute.
        Returns:
        the result of the computation or null if we're entering a computation with this key on this thread recursively,

      • markStack

        @Deprecated
public RecursionGuard.StackStamp markStack()
        Deprecated. Use RecursionManager.markStack() instead

      • currentStack

        public abstract java.util.List<? extends Key> currentStack()
        Note: if you make decisions based on the result of this method, you'd better couple it with prohibitResultCaching(Key), otherwise you might cache inconsistent values.
        Returns:
        the current thread-local stack of keys passed to #doPreventingRecursion(Key, boolean, Computable).

      • prohibitResultCaching

        public abstract void prohibitResultCaching(Key since)
        Makes RecursionGuard.StackStamp.mayCacheNow() return false for all stamps created since a computation with key since began.

        Used to prevent caching of results that are non-reliable NOT due to recursion prevention: for example, too deep recursion (currentStack() may help in determining the recursion depth).

        Also disables thread-local memoization (see the second parameter of doPreventingRecursion(Key, boolean, com.intellij.openapi.util.Computable<T>).
        Parameters:
        since - the id of a computation whose result is safe to cache whilst for more nested ones it's not.
